verses.verse: "But now<WH6258> listen,<WH8085> O Jacob,<WH3290> My servant;<WH5650> And Israel,<WH3478> whom I have chosen: <WH977>

Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068> who made<WH6213> you And formed<WH3335> you from the womb,<WH990> who will help<WH5826> you,' Do not fear,<WH3372> O Jacob<WH3290> My servant;<WH5650> And you Jeshurun<WH3484> whom I have chosen.<WH977>

'For I will pour<WH3332> out water<WH4325> on the thirsty<WH6771> [land] And streams<WH5140> on the dry<WH3004> ground;<WH3004> I will pour<WH3332> out My Spirit<WH7307> on your offspring,<WH6631> And My blessing<WH1293> on your descendants;<WH6631>
And they will spring<WH6779> up among<WH996> the grass<WH2682> Like poplars<WH6155> by streams<WH2988> of water.<WH4325>'

"This<WH2088> one<WH2088> will say,<WH559> 'I am the Lord<WH3068>'s'; And that one<WH2088> will call<WH7121> on the name<WH8034> of Jacob;<WH3290> And another<WH2088> will write<WH3789> [on] his hand,<WH3027> 'Belonging to the Lord,' And will name<WH3655> Israel's name<WH8034> with honor.<WH3655>

"Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord,<WH3068> the King<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> And his Redeemer,<WH1350> the Lord<WH3068> of hosts:<WH6635> 'I am the first<WH7223> and I am the last,<WH314> And there<WH369> is no<WH369> God<WH430> besides<WH4480> <WH1107> Me.

'And who<WH4310> is like<WH3644> Me? Let him proclaim<WH7121> and declare<WH5046> it; Yes, let him recount<WH6186> it to Me in order,<WH6186> From the time that I established<WH7760> the ancient<WH5769> nation.<WH5971> And let them declare<WH5046> to them the things<WH857> that are coming<WH857> And the events that are going to take<WH935> place.<WH935>

'Do not tremble<WH6342> and do not be afraid;<WH9197> Have I not long<WH9241> since<WH9241> announced<WH8085> it to you and declared<WH5046> it? And you are My witnesses.<WH5707> Is there<WH3426> any<WH3426> God<WH433> besides<WH4480> <WH1107> Me, Or is there<WH369> any [other] Rock<WH6697>? I know<WH3045> of none.<WH1077>' "

Those who fashion<WH3335> a graven<WH6459> image<WH6459> are all<WH3605> of them futile,<WH8414> and their precious<WH2530> things<WH2530> are of no<WH1077> profit;<WH3276> even their own witnesses<WH5707> fail<WH1077> to see<WH7200> or know,<WH3045> so<WH4616> that they will be put<WH954> to shame.<WH954>
Who<WH4310> has fashioned<WH3335> a god<WH410> or cast<WH5258> an idol<WH6459> to no<WH1115> profit<WH3276>?

Behold,<WH2005> all<WH3605> his companions<WH2270> will be put<WH954> to shame,<WH954> for the craftsmen<WH2796> themselves<WH1992> are mere<WH4480> men.<WH120> Let them all<WH3605> assemble<WH6908> themselves, let them stand<WH5975> up, let them tremble,<WH6342> let them together<WH3162> be put<WH954> to shame.<WH954>

The man shapes<WH2796> iron<WH1270> into a cutting<WH4621> tool,<WH4621> and does<WH6466> his work<WH6466> over the coals,<WH6352> fashioning<WH3335> it with hammers,<WH4717> and working<WH6466> it with his strong<WH3581> arm.<WH2220> He also<WH1571> gets<WH7456> hungry<WH7456> and his strength<WH3581> fails;<WH369> he drinks<WH8354> no<WH3808> water<WH4325> and becomes<WH3286> weary.<WH3286>

[Another] shapes<WH2796> wood,<WH6086> he extends<WH5186> a measuring<WH6957> line;<WH6957> he outlines<WH8388> it with red chalk.<WH8279> He works<WH6213> it with planes,<WH4741> and outlines<WH8388> it with a compass,<WH4230> and makes<WH6213> it like the form<WH8403> of a man,<WH376> like the beauty<WH8597> of man,<WH120> so that it may sit<WH3427> in a house.<WH1004>

Surely he cuts<WH3772> cedars<WH730> for himself, and takes<WH3947> a cypress<WH8645> or an oak,<WH437> and raises<WH553> [it] for himself among the trees<WH6086> of the forest.<WH9194> He plants<WH5193> a fir,<WH766> and the rain<WH1653> makes<WH1431> it grow.<WH1431>

Then it becomes<WH1961> [something] for a man<WH120> to burn,<WH1197> so he takes<WH3947> one of them and warms<WH2552> himself; he also<WH637> makes<WH9610> a fire<WH9610> to bake<WH644> bread.<WH3899> He also<WH637> makes<WH6466> a god<WH410> and worships<WH7812> it; he makes<WH6213> it a graven<WH6459> image,<WH6459> and falls<WH5456> down<WH5456> before it.

Half<WH2677> of it he burns<WH8313> in the fire;<WH784> over<WH5921> [this] half<WH2677> he eats<WH398> meat<WH1320> as he roasts<WH6740> a roast,<WH6748> and is satisfied.<WH7646> He also<WH637> warms<WH2552> himself and says,<WH559> "Aha!<WH1889> I am warm,<WH2552> I have seen<WH7200> the fire.<WH217>"

But the rest<WH7611> of it he makes<WH6213> into a god,<WH410> his graven<WH6459> image.<WH6459> He falls<WH5456> down<WH5456> before it and worships;<WH7812> he also prays<WH6419> to it and says,<WH559> "Deliver<WH5337> me, for thou art my god.<WH410>"

They do not know,<WH3045> nor<WH3808> do they understand,<WH995> for He has smeared<WH9187> over<WH9187> their eyes<WH5869> so<WH4480> that they cannot<WH4480> see<WH7200> and their hearts<WH3820> so<WH4480> that they cannot<WH4480> comprehend.<WH7919>

And no<WH3808> one recalls<WH7725>,<WH413> <WH3820> nor<WH3808> is there knowledge<WH1847> or understanding<WH8394> to say,<WH559> "I have burned<WH8313> half<WH2677> of it in the fire,<WH784> and also<WH637> have baked<WH644> bread<WH3899> over<WH5921> its coals.<WH1513> I roast<WH6740> meat<WH1320> and eat<WH398> [it.] Then I make<WH6213> the rest<WH3499> of it into an abomination,<WH8441> I fall<WH5456> down<WH5456> before a block<WH944> of wood!<WH6086>"

He feeds<WH7462> on ashes;<WH665> a deceived<WH8524> heart<WH3820> has turned<WH5186> him aside.<WH5186> And he cannot<WH3808> deliver<WH5337> himself,<WH5315> nor<WH3808> say,<WH559> "Is there not a lie<WH8267> in my right<WH3225> hand<WH3225>?"

"Remember<WH2142> these<WH428> things,<WH428> O Jacob,<WH3290> And Israel,<WH3478> for you are My servant;<WH5650> I have formed<WH3335> you, you are My servant,<WH5650> O Israel,<WH3478> you will not be forgotten<WH5382> by Me.

"I have wiped<WH4229> out your transgressions<WH6588> like a thick<WH5645> cloud,<WH5645> And your sins<WH9128> like a heavy<WH6051> mist.<WH6051> Return<WH7725> to Me, for I have redeemed<WH1350> you."

Shout<WH7442> for joy,<WH7442> O heavens,<WH8064> for the Lord<WH3068> has done<WH6213> [it!] Shout<WH7321> joyfully,<WH7321> you lower<WH8482> parts<WH8482> of the earth;<WH776> Break<WH6476> forth<WH6476> into a shout<WH7440> of joy,<WH7440> you mountains,<WH2022> O forest,<WH9194> and every<WH3605> tree<WH6086> in it; For the Lord<WH3068> has redeemed<WH1350> Jacob<WH3290> And in Israel<WH3478> He shows<WH6286> forth His glory.<WH6286>

Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord,<WH3068> your Redeemer,<WH1350> and the one who formed<WH3335> you from the womb,<WH990> "I, the Lord,<WH3068> am the maker<WH6213> of all<WH3605> things,<WH3605> Stretching<WH5186> out the heavens<WH8064> by Myself,<WH905> And spreading<WH7554> out the earth<WH776> all<WH4480> <WH854> alone,<WH4480> <WH854>

Causing the omens<WH226> of boasters<WH907> to fail,<WH6565> Making<WH1984> fools<WH1984> out of diviners,<WH7080> Causing wise<WH2450> men<WH2450> to draw<WH7725> back,<WH268> And turning<WH7725> their knowledge<WH1847> into foolishness,<WH5528>

Confirming<WH6965> the word<WH1697> of His servant,<WH5650> And performing<WH9608> the purpose<WH6098> of His messengers.<WH4397> [It is I] who says<WH559> of Jerusalem,<WH3389> 'She shall be inhabited!<WH3427>' And of the cities<WH5892> of Judah,<WH3063> 'They shall be built.<WH1129>' And I will raise<WH6965> up her ruins<WH2723> [again.]
"[It is I] who says<WH559> to the depth<WH6683> of the sea,<WH6683> 'Be dried<WH9162> up!' And I will make<WH3001> your rivers<WH5104> dry.<WH3001>

"[It is I] who says<WH559> of Cyrus,<WH3566> '[He is] My shepherd!<WH7462> And he will perform<WH9608> all<WH3605> My desire.<WH2656>' And he declares<WH559> of Jerusalem,<WH3389> 'She will be built,<WH1129>' And of the temple,<WH1964> 'Your foundation<WH3245> will be laid.<WH3245>'"
